title: Mike Tyson defies his age as he showcases devastating hand speed to fans

Mike Tyson showed that age is just a number by demonstrating his incredible hand speed while handing out some boxing tips.

Tyson, one of the most explosive boxers ever, was giving some coaching advice as he filmed his latest Hotboxin’ podcast.

In the clip posted on his Instagram account, the American dodges and weaves before unloading with both hands, looking as dangerous as he did throughout his career.

"It's all about keeping your distance," he says to a pupil. "Stay outside of the shoulder. You know when he's here, the punches go, boom, boom, to the back of the head."

(Image: miketyson/Instagram)

Tyson dodges and ducks behind his pupil, tapping him on the lower back and the head to demonstrate how an opponent could take advantage of the situation.

During an episode of the Hotboxin’ podcast, ‘Iron Mike’ told lineal heavyweight champion Tyson Fury he was pleased with how he has turned his life around after leaving the ring.

“I can’t believe I wanted to die so often when I was young - I used to think, ‘God, I hate living,'" he said.

(Image: miketyson/Instagram)

“Now I’m 53. I love living, I don’t want to f*****g die, I hate the fact I got to die now.

“Living is so interesting.”

Tyson is one of the most powerful boxers ever - he won 44 of his 58 fights via knockout, but endured tough times outside the ring throughout his career.
description: Tyson was giving a short coaching session to a fan before filming his 'Hotboxin' podcast
